column5: There could be over 1 000 000 litres of gas entering the creek since march (not in the article, different source). It's a nasty spill and difficult to clean up...  this isn't good for anything.  http://www.insidehalton.com/insidehalton/article/806574
There's been lots activity down there lately. Booms and workers and such. I usually see them when passing by on the GO train. Guess it's taking a while to clean up.
They are starting to remove the soil and use vac trucks, but the terrain and slope are killing them! It won't be an easy or quick clean up.
typical, another disaster, there won't be much left by the time we realize it's too late
